originalText.text:
My mother was at this facility for over 4 years and because of that I was able to know most of the nurses and workers there. My mother had dementia and was always confused so they were patient with her.
I understood her disease and so did the nurses. They took good care of her and always called me to keep me updated on her health. Sadly, my mother became very ill and I had to send her to Presbyterian Hospice, where she sadly passed on 1/2/24. I will miss the Isabella staff and just want to say "Thank you" to all their help and support.

originalText.text:
I stayed here for almost two weeks some years back.  I was on disability at the time, and I had Medicare.
My experience was not entirely pleasant, but it also had its good points: the nurses on duty at that time, the attention I received was slow at first, but my spouse was able to advocate for me.  I was housed in a room on the rehab side that had 2 beds in it. I had a not-so-good neighbor at the time. She was so rude to the nurses on our watch. The downside of the experience was the leaking hot water faucet in the bathroom that was never addressed while I was there.  It made the room hot and stinky.  The other downside was the food.
Today I went to visit a friend who is also staying there. I asked about the food and he said it was horrendous.  I shook my head to myself in disbelief. It seems to me that because people are poor they are fed sub-fresh food, over cooked vegetables, and things that look outdated.  I was hoping to hear that the food had improved, but no.  I really wish they would feed everyone good food, fresh produce, things that are not soggy and overcooked. There is always room for improvement.

originalText.text:
I want to celebrate the passion and commitment of Isabella nursing center.
Just like beauty in the eye of the beholder, service is kind of the same thing.
Isabella has consistently delivered to  my expectations with both of my parents.
Isabella was the first nursing center I ever visited as a student of George Washington HS. This is 31 years ago and since then,  they have been the place I gravitate to in times of needs.

Micel in admissions is great. He has assisted me many times. He is compassionate, patient and personable.

I don’t normally take the time to write reviews but this is a place that I personally trust when it comes to my dear ones.

Thank you again!

originalText.text: My mom stays after surgery about 1 months already.   We expected to recover from the surgery.   However the service was so terrible. My mom should stay all day in the bed.  I asked to put her in the chair  during weekends and no response.   She has low quality PT services as well occupational therapy.  Not spending much time with patient.  Also I received not pleasant response on weekend nurse.    We need much improvement of the service and taking care about patients.   Also the food is terrible.  No Frits no vegetables.  Mostly food from cans

originalText.text:
My mother stood at Isabella at Isabella for 3 month's and she passed. She should have never passed, I never got a clear explanation as to why either.
If you truly love your family members don't take them to this place. Its looks nice but they don’t care and are short staffed. Dont do it!
